Hi,

I am using Cantera on a Linux box to replace Chemkin calls within a
Fo=
rtran code and ran into something that I cannot figure out.  We need
to be =
able to access the sixth thermodynamic coefficient of the lower
temperature=
 fit for a given component.  This value is altered in our
code to change th=
e reference enthalpy value for a given ingredient. 
In our case (in which w=
e are modeling solid rocket propellants) the
enthalpy reference value somet=
imes needs to be altered to take into
account an enthalpy change associated=
 with the addition of a
particular type of curative in a given amount.  We =
have found it is
easier to change this value on the fly rather than to chan=
ge the input
values in the mechanism file.  I was curious if there is curre=
ntly any
way to access these values from within Cantera.  If not, is there =
some
way to get this built in?  We need to be able to change the value of
t=
his coefficient, and not just get its value.  Thanks.

Dan Smyth
